title: Workshop on Developing Digital Learning-Based Scientific Inquiry Competency Content

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level scientific theories, proficiency in high-end digital tools, and foundational understanding of experimental design principles
context.additional_context: Training focused on creating H5P-based interactive content supporting scientific inquiry activities (observation, hypothesis formulation, experimental design, data analysis, conclusion) in smartphone-limited environments.

learning_goals: Learners design e-learning content reflecting scientific experimental procedures following the ADDIE model’s phased process.
Learners create two or more interactive presentations on variable control for science education using H5P tools.
Learners evaluate science experiment simulation content (mobile-compatible) based on observation, measurement, and analysis criteria.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
